title: How to Make "Better Than Sex" Cake

steps.headline: Pre-heat oven to 350°.
Pour cake mix into a big bowl.
Break 2 large eggs into the bowl with cake mix, as well as vegetable oil (¼ cup) and water.
Stir until mixed well.
steps.description: If mixture is deep yellow, add another egg white. if mixture is not soft enough, pour 2 teaspoons of vegetable oil and ½ cup water

steps.headline: Bake until you can put a toothpick into the cake and it comes out clean.
steps.description: While poking holes in cake, it might break so do it gently

steps.headline: Turn off oven and take out the cake
Poke holes all over the cake with the back of a wooden spoon
Mix sweetened condensed milk and caramel together in a soft pan
Heat the sweetened condensed milk and caramel mixture on a stove until they turn into a moist liquid.
steps.description:
(Stir while heating)
If mixture of condensed milk and caramel is too sweet, add ½ cup of water

steps.headline: Once it's a liquid, pour all over the cake
Put cake into fridge for 6-12 hours
Cover top of cake with whipped cream and crushed heath bars
Pre-heat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius).
steps.description: This step is very important for the baking process

steps.headline: Open the box of cake mix and dump it into a big bowl.
steps.description:
Add the two large eggs
Pour the ¼ cup of vegetable oil
Pour the ½ cup of water into the bowl

steps.headline: Stir the ingredients for a few minutes (2-3) until they are mixed really well.
steps.description: The mixture should be smooth and consistent

steps.headline: Place the bowl into the oven and bake for 30-40 minutes
steps.description: Depending on what type of oven you use the time may vary

steps.headline: Use a toothpick to check if the cake is ready
steps.description: When the toothpick comes out clean, take out the cake and turn off the oven

steps.headline: Poke small holes all over the cake with the back of a wooden spoon
steps.description: Do not to use excess force, instead be careful

steps.headline: Mix together the ½ cup of sweetened & condensed milk and the ½ cup of caramel into a soft pan
steps.description: Heat the mix on the stove until it becomes a moist liquid. Stir while heating the mix

steps.headline: Pour the mix over the cake starting with the middle and then moving slowly towards the corners
steps.description: Note you may keep the cake in its original baking bowl also you may use a different serving bowl during this step. Place the bowl in the fridge and let it cool for 6 hours

steps.headline: Cover the cake with whipped cream
steps.description: The amount of whipped cream and style is open to your taste

steps.headline: Crush the heath bars and sprinkle them on the cake
steps.description: Optional, add final touches such as pouring a little bit of caramel on top or chocolate syrup

text:
Recipe 1 Pre-heat oven to 350°.  Pour cake mix into a big bowl.  Break 2 large eggs into the bowl with cake mix, as well as vegetable oil (¼ cup) and water. (½ cup) Stir until mixed well. If mixture is deep yellow, add another egg white. if mixture is not soft enough, pour 2 teaspoons of vegetable oil and ½ cup water Bake until you can put a toothpick into the cake and it comes out clean. While poking holes in cake, it might break so do it gently Turn off oven and take out the cake  Poke holes all over the cake with the back of a wooden spoon  Mix sweetened condensed milk and caramel together in a soft pan  Heat the sweetened condensed milk and caramel mixture on a stove until they turn into a moist liquid. (Stir while heating)
If mixture of condensed milk and caramel is too sweet, add ½ cup of water Once it's a liquid, pour all over the cake  Put cake into fridge for 6-12 hours  Cover top of cake with whipped cream and crushed heath bars  Recipe 2 Pre-heat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius). This step is very important for the baking process Open the box of cake mix and dump it into a big bowl. Add the two large eggs
Pour the ¼ cup of vegetable oil
Pour the ½ cup of water into the bowl Stir the ingredients for a few minutes (2-3) until they are mixed really well. The mixture should be smooth and consistent Place the bowl into the oven and bake for 30-40 minutes Depending on what type of oven you use the time may vary Use a toothpick to check if the cake is ready When the toothpick comes out clean, take out the cake and turn off the oven Poke small holes all over the cake with the back of a wooden spoon Do not to use excess force, instead be careful Mix together the ½ cup of sweetened & condensed milk and the ½ cup of caramel into a soft pan Heat the mix on the stove until it becomes a moist liquid. Stir while heating the mix Pour the mix over the cake starting with the middle and then moving slowly towards the corners Note you may keep the cake in its original baking bowl also you may use a different serving bowl during this step. Place the bowl in the fridge and let it cool for 6 hours Cover the cake with whipped cream The amount of whipped cream and style is open to your taste Crush the heath bars and sprinkle them on the cake Optional, add final touches such as pouring a little bit of caramel on top or chocolate syrup
